title: Object - Equity Compensation Issuance Transaction
description: Object describing securities issuance transaction by the issuer and held by a stakeholder as a form of compensation (as noted elsewhere, RSAs are not included here intentionally and should be modelled using Stock Issuances).

object_type.description: This is done to avoid a breaking change as we work towards a bigger restructure of the equity types in v2.0.0. `TX_PLAN_SECURITY_ISSUANCE` will be deprecated in v2.0.0

stock_plan_id.description: If the equity compensation was issued from a plan (don't forget, plan-less options are a thing), what is the plan id.
stock_plan_id.$comment: If this is provided, stock_class_id cannot be set due to the oneOf below

stock_class_id.description: If the equity compensation was NOT issued from a plan (don't forget, plan-less options are a thing), we need to know what underlying stock class it converts to.
stock_class_id.$comment: If this is provided, stock_plan_id cannot be set due to the oneOf below

compensation_type.description: If the plan security is compensation, what kind?

option_grant_type.description: If the plan security is an option, what kind?
option_grant_type.$comment: DEPRECATION WARNING - This field is being retained for compatibility, but these variations have been incorporated into CompensationType.schema.json enum options

quantity.description: How many shares are subject to this plan security?

exercise_price.description: If this is an option, what is the exercise price of the option?

base_price.description: If this is a stock appreciation right, what is the base price used to calculate the appreciation of the SAR?

vesting_terms_id.description: Identifier of the VestingTerms to which this security is subject.  If not present, security is fully vested on issuance.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date of the plan security

termination_exercise_windows.title: Plan Security - Termination Window Array
termination_exercise_windows.description: Exercise periods applicable to plan security after a termination for a given, enumerated reason
